intro: Mesembryanthemum pakhuisense, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, often hairy leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically blooms in winter, producing yellow or orange flowers that attract pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and arid landscapes. Its adaptations to drought and high temperatures make it a resilient species in its native habitat.
